metadata.description: Required. Name of the Database Account.
Optional. Location for all resources.
Optional. Tags of the Database Account resource.
Optional. Enables system assigned managed identity on the resource.
Optional. The ID(s) to assign to the resource.
Optional. The offer type for the Cosmos DB database account.
Required. Locations enabled for the Cosmos DB account.
Optional. The default consistency level of the Cosmos DB account.
Optional. Enable automatic failover for regions.
Optional. Flag to indicate whether Free Tier is enabled.
Optional. Max stale requests. Required for BoundedStaleness. Valid ranges, Single Region: 10 to 1000000. Multi Region: 100000 to 1000000.
Optional. Max lag time (minutes). Required for BoundedStaleness. Valid ranges, Single Region: 5 to 84600. Multi Region: 300 to 86400.
Optional. Specifies the MongoDB server version to use.
Optional. SQL Databases configurations.
Optional. MongoDB Databases configurations.
Optional. Gremlin Databases configurations.
Optional. Enable telemetry via a Globally Unique Identifier (GUID).
Optional. Specify the type of lock.

Optional. Array of role assignment objects that contain the 'roleDefinitionIdOrName' and 'principalIds' to define RBAC role assignments on this resource. In the roleDefinitionIdOrName attribute, you can provide either the display name of the role definition, or its fully qualified ID in the following format: '/providers/Microsoft.Authorization/roleDefinitions/c2f4ef07-c644-48eb-af81-4b1b4947fb11'.
Optional. Specifies the number of days that logs will be kept for; a value of 0 will retain data indefinitely.
Optional. Resource ID of the diagnostic storage account.
Optional. Resource ID of the log analytics workspace.
Optional. Resource ID of the diagnostic event hub authorization rule for the Event Hubs namespace in which the event hub should be created or streamed to.
Optional. Name of the diagnostic event hub within the namespace to which logs are streamed. Without this, an event hub is created for each log category.
Optional. The name of logs that will be streamed. "allLogs" includes all possible logs for the resource. Set to '' to disable log collection.
Optional. The name of metrics that will be streamed.
Optional. The name of the diagnostic setting, if deployed. If left empty, it defaults to "<resourceName>-diagnosticSettings".
Optional. List of Cosmos DB capabilities for the account.
Optional. Describes the mode of backups.
Optional. Configuration values for continuous mode backup.
Optional. An integer representing the interval in minutes between two backups. Only applies to periodic backup type.
Optional. An integer representing the time (in hours) that each backup is retained. Only applies to periodic backup type.
Optional. Enum to indicate type of backup residency. Only applies to periodic backup type.

variables.diagnosticsLogs: [if(contains(parameters('diagnosticLogCategoriesToEnable'), 'allLogs'), createArray(createObject('categoryGroup', 'allLogs', 'enabled', true(), 'retentionPolicy', createObject('enabled', true(), 'days', parameters('diagnosticLogsRetentionInDays')))), if(contains(parameters('diagnosticLogCategoriesToEnable'), ''), createArray(), variables('diagnosticsLogsSpecified')))]
variables.backupPolicy: [if(equals(parameters('backupPolicyType'), 'Continuous'), createObject('type', parameters('backupPolicyType'), 'continuousModeProperties', createObject('tier', parameters('backupPolicyContinuousTier'))), createObject('type', parameters('backupPolicyType'), 'periodicModeProperties', createObject('backupIntervalInMinutes', parameters('backupIntervalInMinutes'), 'backupRetentionIntervalInHours', parameters('backupRetentionIntervalInHours'), 'backupStorageRedundancy', parameters('backupStorageRedundancy'))))]
variables.databaseAccount_properties: [union(createObject('databaseAccountOfferType', parameters('databaseAccountOfferType')), if(or(or(not(empty(parameters('sqlDatabases'))), not(empty(parameters('mongodbDatabases')))), not(empty(parameters('gremlinDatabases')))), createObject('consistencyPolicy', variables('consistencyPolicy')[parameters('defaultConsistencyLevel')], 'locations', variables('databaseAccount_locations'), 'capabilities', variables('capabilities'), 'enableFreeTier', parameters('enableFreeTier'), 'backupPolicy', variables('backupPolicy')), createObject()), if(not(empty(parameters('sqlDatabases'))), createObject('enableAutomaticFailover', parameters('automaticFailover')), createObject()), if(not(empty(parameters('mongodbDatabases'))), createObject('apiProperties', createObject('serverVersion', parameters('serverVersion'))), createObject()))]

properties.notes: [if(equals(parameters('lock'), 'CanNotDelete'), 'Cannot delete resource or child resources.', 'Cannot modify the resource or child resources.')]

metadata.description: Required. The IDs of the principals to assign the role to.
Required. The name of the role to assign. If it cannot be found you can specify the role definition ID instead.
Required. The resource ID of the resource to apply the role assignment to.
Optional. The principal type of the assigned principal ID.
Optional. The description of the role assignment.

Optional. The conditions on the role assignment. This limits the resources it can be assigned to. e.g.: @Resource[Microsoft.Storage/storageAccounts/blobServices/containers:ContainerName] StringEqualsIgnoreCase "foo_storage_container".
Optional. Version of the condition.
Optional. Id of the delegated managed identity resource.
Conditional. The name of the parent Database Account. Required if the template is used in a standalone deployment.
Required. Name of the SQL database .
Optional. Array of containers to deploy in the SQL database.
Optional. Request units per second. Will be set to null if autoscaleSettingsMaxThroughput is used.

Optional. Specifies the Autoscale settings and represents maximum throughput, the resource can scale up to.  The autoscale throughput should have valid throughput values between 1000 and 1000000 inclusive in increments of 1000. If value is set to -1, then the property will be set to null and autoscale will be disabled.
Optional. Tags of the SQL database resource.
Optional. Enable telemetry via a Globally Unique Identifier (GUID).

properties.options: [if(contains(reference(resourceId('Microsoft.DocumentDB/databaseAccounts', parameters('databaseAccountName')), '2023-04-15').capabilities, createObject('name', 'EnableServerless')), null(), createObject('throughput', if(equals(parameters('autoscaleSettingsMaxThroughput'), -1), parameters('throughput'), null()), 'autoscaleSettings', if(not(equals(parameters('autoscaleSettingsMaxThroughput'), -1)), createObject('maxThroughput', parameters('autoscaleSettingsMaxThroughput')), null())))]

metadata.description: Conditional. The name of the parent Database Account. Required if the template is used in a standalone deployment.
Conditional. The name of the parent SQL Database. Required if the template is used in a standalone deployment.
Required. Name of the container.

Optional. Indicates how long data should be retained in the analytical store, for a container. Analytical store is enabled when ATTL is set with a value other than 0. If the value is set to -1, the analytical store retains all historical data, irrespective of the retention of the data in the transactional store.
Optional. The conflict resolution policy for the container. Conflicts and conflict resolution policies are applicable if the Azure Cosmos DB account is configured with multiple write regions.

Optional. Default time to live (in seconds). With Time to Live or TTL, Azure Cosmos DB provides the ability to delete items automatically from a container after a certain time period. If the value is set to "-1", it is equal to infinity, and items dont expire by default.
Optional. Request Units per second. Will be set to null if autoscaleSettingsMaxThroughput is used.

Optional. Specifies the Autoscale settings and represents maximum throughput, the resource can scale up to. The autoscale throughput should have valid throughput values between 1000 and 1000000 inclusive in increments of 1000. If value is set to -1, then the property will be set to null and autoscale will be disabled.
Optional. Tags of the SQL Database resource.
Optional. List of paths using which data within the container can be partitioned.
Optional. Indexing policy of the container.
Optional. The unique key policy configuration containing a list of unique keys that enforces uniqueness constraint on documents in the collection in the Azure Cosmos DB service.
Optional. Indicates the kind of algorithm used for partitioning.
Optional. Enable telemetry via a Globally Unique Identifier (GUID).

properties.options: [if(contains(reference(resourceId('Microsoft.DocumentDB/databaseAccounts', parameters('databaseAccountName')), '2023-04-15').capabilities, createObject('name', 'EnableServerless')), null(), createObject('throughput', if(equals(parameters('autoscaleSettingsMaxThroughput'), -1), parameters('throughput'), null()), 'autoscaleSettings', if(not(equals(parameters('autoscaleSettingsMaxThroughput'), -1)), createObject('maxThroughput', parameters('autoscaleSettingsMaxThroughput')), null())))]

metadata.description: The name of the container.
The resource ID of the container.
The name of the resource group the container was created in.
The name of the SQL database.
The resource ID of the SQL database.
The name of the resource group the SQL database was created in.
Conditional. The name of the parent Cosmos DB database account. Required if the template is used in a standalone deployment.
Required. Name of the mongodb database.
Optional. Name of the mongodb database.
Optional. Collections in the mongodb database.
Optional. Tags of the resource.
Optional. Enable telemetry via a Globally Unique Identifier (GUID).
Conditional. The name of the parent Cosmos DB database account. Required if the template is used in a standalone deployment.
Conditional. The name of the parent mongodb database. Required if the template is used in a standalone deployment.
Required. Name of the collection.
Optional. Name of the mongodb database.
Required. Indexes for the collection.
Required. ShardKey for the collection.
Optional. Enable telemetry via a Globally Unique Identifier (GUID).
The name of the mongodb database.
The resource ID of the mongodb database.
The name of the resource group the mongodb database was created in.
The name of the mongodb database.
The resource ID of the mongodb database.
The name of the resource group the mongodb database was created in.
Required. Name of the Gremlin database.
Optional. Tags of the Gremlin database resource.
Optional. Enables system assigned managed identity on the resource.
Optional. The ID(s) to assign to the resource.
Conditional. The name of the parent Gremlin database. Required if the template is used in a standalone deployment.
Optional. Array of graphs to deploy in the Gremlin database.
Optional. Represents maximum throughput, the resource can scale up to. Cannot be set together with `throughput`. If `throughput` is set to something else than -1, this autoscale setting is ignored.
Optional. Request Units per second (for example 10000). Cannot be set together with `maxThroughput`.
Optional. Enable telemetry via a Globally Unique Identifier (GUID).

properties.options: [if(contains(reference(resourceId('Microsoft.DocumentDB/databaseAccounts', parameters('databaseAccountName')), '2023-04-15').capabilities, createObject('name', 'EnableServerless')), createObject(), createObject('autoscaleSettings', if(equals(parameters('throughput'), -1), createObject('maxThroughput', parameters('maxThroughput')), null()), 'throughput', if(not(equals(parameters('throughput'), -1)), parameters('throughput'), null())))]

metadata.description: Required. Name of the graph.
Optional. Tags of the Gremlin graph resource.
Optional. Enable telemetry via a Globally Unique Identifier (GUID).
Conditional. The name of the parent Database Account. Required if the template is used in a standalone deployment.
Conditional. The name of the parent Gremlin Database. Required if the template is used in a standalone deployment.
Optional. Indexing policy of the graph.
Optional. List of paths using which data within the container can be partitioned.
The name of the graph.
The resource ID of the graph.
The name of the resource group the graph was created in.
The name of the Gremlin database.
The resource ID of the Gremlin database.
The name of the resource group the Gremlin database was created in.
The name of the database account.
The resource ID of the database account.
The name of the resource group the database account was created in.
The principal ID of the system assigned identity.
The location the resource was deployed into.
